title: Sports Illustrated's shock therapy is a sign of the times but magazine's demise still a sorry story
text:
Sports Illustrated is the Manchester United of sports magazines. Focusing mainly on baseball, basketball and gridiron, it reaches more than 20 million global readers every week, and does so with an artistry and diligence to match other famous American titles: The New Yorker, perhaps, or Time.

And yet, like its footballing counterpart, Sports Illustrated has fallen victim to a corporate takeover that threatens to rip out its soul. In May, it was bought by Authentic Brands Group – a consortium whose conduct has so far failed to live up to its name.
